issue.title: [Release] Packages not available for Amazon Linux 2
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13484](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13484). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Following the instructions on the website, the Amazon Linux repo added to yum by the apache-arrow-release-latest rpm doesn't actually even exist (<https://apache.jfrog.io/artifactory/arrow/amazon-linux/2/)> and causes yum to throw errors after installing that package.

 

There is an rc repo that does seem to exist <https://apache.jfrog.io/artifactory/arrow/amazon-linux-rc/2/>, although most of the packages are missing for aarch64 (I'm trying to use Arrow on a Graviton2 instance)
